sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均含"愤怒"之意。
means: anger ：普通用词，通常指因受到侮辱、损害、指责或顶撞等而引起的愤怒。
indignation ：较正式用词，指出于正义或对不公正之事而发出的愤怒。
fury ：语气最强，指极端的气愤，甚至达到发疯的程度。
rage ：侧重突然而猛列发作，难以控制的大怒。
wrath ：文学用词，含义与anger相近，但语气强，含欲加惩罚或报复的意味。

sentence.Network_en: She had incurred the wrath of her father by marrying without his consent
sentence.Network_cn: 她未经父亲同意就结婚，使父亲震怒。

sentence.Network_en: By their sin they provoked the wrath of the people.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们因犯罪而激起人民的愤怒.

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English wræththu, from wrāth (see wroth)

entry.def: Wrath means the same as anger .

example.ex: He incurred the wrath of the authorities in speaking out against government injustices.
example.tran: 他直言批评政府的不公正做法，招致当局震怒。

means.word_mean: 1. intense anger (usually on an epic scale)
2. belligerence aroused by a real or supposed wrong (personified as one of the deadly sins)
